alert.note: Alert for Adams; Buffalo; Clay; Dawson; Franklin; Furnas; Gosper; Harlan; Kearney; Nuckolls; Phelps; Thayer; Webster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 18 at 10:44AM CST until January 19 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A QUICK HIT OF SNOW THIS AFTERNOON, FOLLOWED BY LINGERING BLOWING SNOW... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory this evening into Friday morning, very cold wind chills as low as -15 to -20 expected. For the Wind Chill Watch for Friday evening into Saturday morning, dangerously cold wind chills as low as -15 to -30 possible. * WHERE...Portions of north central Kansas and south central Nebraska. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to noon CST Friday. For the Wind Chill Watch, from Friday evening through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...In addition to the dangerous wind chill concerns, and although amounts are expected to range from only a dusting to less than 1 inch, please note that a quick hit of snow this afternoon could reduce visibility and cause slick roads for the evening commute in parts of the area.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation.
